definition: A type of unconventional warfare strategy involving small, mobile, and irregular forces that engage in surprise attacks, ambushes, and hit-and-run tactics against a larger, more organized military or government forces. It is commonly associated with conflicts in which the weaker side employs guerrilla tactics to resist or undermine an occupying or oppressive force.
